If you're a typography enthusiast, you've probably come across a website or a graphic design with a font that caught your eye. Identifying that font can be a challenge, especially if you don't have access to the original source file or don't know the font's name.

That's where WhatFont comes in. WhatFont is a popular browser extension that helps you identify fonts on any website. Whether you're a designer, developer, or just curious, WhatFont can save you time and frustration.

## How Does WhatFont Work?

Once you install the WhatFont extension in your browser, a small icon appears on the toolbar. When you come across a font that you want to identify, simply activate the extension and hover the cursor over the text in question. WhatFont will display the font name, size, line height, and color.

WhatFont can also recognize web fonts, so you can use it to learn more about the typography used on your favorite websites. It supports multiple languages and can display font information in your preferred measurement units.

## Why Should You Use WhatFont?

There are several reasons why WhatFont is a valuable tool for anyone who works with or appreciates typography:

### 1. Efficiency

Identifying fonts manually can take a lot of time, especially if you're not familiar with typography. With WhatFont, you can find out the font name and other information in seconds, without having to do any research.

### 2. Inspiration

If you're a designer, WhatFont can be a valuable source of inspiration. By exploring the typography used on different websites, you can discover new fonts and trends to incorporate into your own work.

### 3. Education

Even if you're not a typography expert, WhatFont can help you learn more about fonts and how they work. By examining different fonts and their properties, you can deepen your understanding of design and improve your skills.

## How to Get WhatFont

WhatFont is available as a browser extension for Chrome, Safari, and Firefox. The extension is free to download and use. Simply search for "WhatFont" in your browser's extension store and follow the instructions to install it.

## Conclusion

WhatFont is an essential tool for anyone who works with typography or just appreciates good design. By quickly and easily identifying fonts on any website, WhatFont can help you save time, find inspiration, and deepen your knowledge. So why not give it a try and see how it can enrich your work and your browsing experience?
